name: boot::memory_region::MemoryRegionType
doc_adt: The type of initial memory regions that are needed for the kernel.

VariantIdx(Some(0))-FieldIdx(None).name: BadMemory
VariantIdx(Some(0))-FieldIdx(None).doc: Maybe points to an unplugged DIMM module. It's bad anyway.

VariantIdx(Some(1))-FieldIdx(None).name: Unknown
VariantIdx(Some(1))-FieldIdx(None).doc:
Some holes not specified by the bootloader/firmware. It may be used for
 I/O memory but we don't know for sure.

VariantIdx(Some(2))-FieldIdx(None).name: NonVolatileSleep
VariantIdx(Some(2))-FieldIdx(None).doc: In ACPI spec, this area needs to be preserved when sleeping.

VariantIdx(Some(3))-FieldIdx(None).name: Reserved
VariantIdx(Some(3))-FieldIdx(None).doc: Reserved by BIOS or bootloader, do not use.

VariantIdx(Some(4))-FieldIdx(None).name: Kernel
VariantIdx(Some(4))-FieldIdx(None).doc: The place where kernel sections are loaded.

VariantIdx(Some(5))-FieldIdx(None).name: Module
VariantIdx(Some(5))-FieldIdx(None).doc: The place where kernel modules (e.g. initrd) are loaded, could be reused.

VariantIdx(Some(6))-FieldIdx(None).name: Framebuffer
VariantIdx(Some(6))-FieldIdx(None).doc: The memory region provided as the framebuffer.

VariantIdx(Some(7))-FieldIdx(None).name: Reclaimable
VariantIdx(Some(7))-FieldIdx(None).doc: Once used in the boot phase. Kernel can reclaim it after initialization.

VariantIdx(Some(8))-FieldIdx(None).name: Usable
VariantIdx(Some(8))-FieldIdx(None).doc: Directly usable by the frame allocator.
